    1335                 :          0 : void CWallet::MarkConflicted(const uint256& hashBlock, const uint256& hashTx)
    1336                 :            : {

    1342                 :            :     // that the block is still unknown or not yet part of the main chain,
    1343                 :            :     // for example when loading the wallet during a reindex. Do nothing in that
    1344                 :            :     // case.

    1415                 :          0 : void CWallet::BlockConnected(const CBlock& block, const std::vector<CTransactionRef>& vtxConflicted) {
    1416                 :          0 :     const uint256& block_hash = block.GetHash();
    1417 [ #  # ][ #  # ]:          0 :     auto locked_chain = chain().lock();
    1418 [ #  # ][ #  # ]:          0 :     LOCK(cs_wallet);
                 [ #  # ]
    1419                 :            :     // TODO: Temporarily ensure that mempool removals are notified before
    1420                 :            :     // connected transactions.  This shouldn't matter, but the abandoned
    1421                 :            :     // state of transactions in our wallet is currently cleared when we
    1422                 :            :     // receive another notification and there is a race condition where
    1423                 :            :     // notification of a connected conflict might cause an outside process
    1424                 :            :     // to abandon a transaction and then have it inadvertently cleared by
    1425                 :            :     // the notification that the conflicted transaction was evicted.
    1426                 :            : 
    1427 [ #  # ][ #  # ]:          0 :     for (const CTransactionRef& ptx : vtxConflicted) {
    1428 [ #  # ][ #  # ]:          0 :         SyncTransaction(ptx, {} /* block hash */, 0 /* position in block */);
    1429         [ #  # ]:          0 :         TransactionRemovedFromMempool(ptx);
    1430                 :            :     }
    1431 [ #  # ][ #  # ]:          0 :     for (size_t i = 0; i < block.vtx.size(); i++) {
    1432 [ #  # ][ #  # ]:          0 :         SyncTransaction(block.vtx[i], block_hash, i);
    1433 [ #  # ][ #  # ]:          0 :         TransactionRemovedFromMempool(block.vtx[i]);
    1434                 :            :     }
    1435                 :            : 
    1436         [ #  # ]:          0 :     m_last_block_processed = block_hash;
    1437                 :          0 : }
    1438                 :            :

    2007                 :            : /**
    2008                 :            :  * Scan the block chain (starting in start_block) for transactions
    2009                 :            :  * from or to us. If fUpdate is true, found transactions that already
    2010                 :            :  * exist in the wallet will be updated.
    2011                 :            :  *
    2012                 :            :  * @param[in] start_block Scan starting block. If block is not on the active
    2013                 :            :  *                        chain, the scan will return SUCCESS immediately.
    2014                 :            :  * @param[in] stop_block  Scan ending block. If block is not on the active
    2015                 :            :  *                        chain, the scan will continue until it reaches the
    2016                 :            :  *                        chain tip.
    2017                 :            :  *
    2018                 :            :  * @return ScanResult returning scan information and indicating success or
    2019                 :            :  *         failure. Return status will be set to SUCCESS if scan was
    2020                 :            :  *         successful. FAILURE if a complete rescan was not possible (due to
    2021                 :            :  *         pruning or corruption). USER_ABORT if the rescan was aborted before
    2022                 :            :  *         it could complete.
    2023                 :            :  *
    2024                 :            :  * @pre Caller needs to make sure start_block (and the optional stop_block) are on
    2025                 :            :  * the main chain after to the addition of any new keys you want to detect
    2026                 :            :  * transactions for.
    2027                 :            :  */

    2340                 :            : }
    2341                 :            : 
    2342                 :            : // Rebroadcast transactions from the wallet. We do this on a random timer
    2343                 :            : // to slightly obfuscate which transactions come from our wallet.
    2344                 :            : //
    2345                 :            : // Ideally, we'd only resend transactions that we think should have been
    2346                 :            : // mined in the most recent block. Any transaction that wasn't in the top
    2347                 :            : // blockweight of transactions in the mempool shouldn't have been mined,
    2348                 :            : // and so is probably just sitting in the mempool waiting to be confirmed.
    2349                 :            : // Rebroadcasting does nothing to speed up confirmation and only damages
    2350                 :            : // privacy.
    2351                 :          0 : void CWallet::ResendWalletTransactions()
    2352                 :            : {
    2353                 :            :     // During reindex, importing and IBD, old wallet transactions become
    2354                 :            :     // unconfirmed. Don't resend them as that would spam other nodes.
    2355 [ #  # ][ #  # ]:          0 :     if (!chain().isReadyToBroadcast()) return;
    2356                 :            : 
    2357                 :            :     // Do this infrequently and randomly to avoid giving away
    2358                 :            :     // that these are our transactions.
    2359 [ #  # ][ #  # ]:          0 :     if (GetTime() < nNextResend || !fBroadcastTransactions) return;
    2360                 :          0 :     bool fFirst = (nNextResend == 0);
    2361                 :          0 :     nNextResend = GetTime() + GetRand(30 * 60);
    2362         [ #  # ]:          0 :     if (fFirst) return;
    2363                 :            : 
    2364                 :            :     // Only do it if there's been a new block since last time
    2365 [ #  # ][ #  # ]:          0 :     if (m_best_block_time < nLastResend) return;
    2366                 :          0 :     nLastResend = GetTime();
    2367                 :            : 
    2368                 :          0 :     int submitted_tx_count = 0;
    2369                 :            : 
    2370                 :          0 :     { // locked_chain and cs_wallet scope
    2371 [ #  # ][ #  # ]:          0 :         auto locked_chain = chain().lock();
    2372 [ #  # ][ #  # ]:          0 :         LOCK(cs_wallet);
         [ #  # ][ #  # ]
    2373                 :            : 
    2374                 :            :         // Relay transactions
    2375 [ #  # ][ #  # ]:          0 :         for (std::pair<const uint256, CWalletTx>& item : mapWallet) {

    2376                 :          0 :             CWalletTx& wtx = item.second;
    2377                 :            :             // only rebroadcast unconfirmed txes older than 5 minutes before the
    2378                 :            :             // last block was found

    2487                 :            :         // other transactions.
    2488                 :            :         //
    2489                 :            :         // Example: There is a transaction A which is replaced by bumpfee
    2490                 :            :         // transaction B. In this case, we want to prevent creation of
    2491                 :            :         // a transaction B' which spends an output of B.
    2492                 :            :         //
    2493                 :            :         // Reason: If transaction A were initially confirmed, transactions B
    2494                 :            :         // and B' would no longer be valid, so the user would have to create
    2495                 :            :         // a new transaction C to replace B'. However, in the case of a
    2496                 :            :         // one-block reorg, transactions B' and C might BOTH be accepted,
    2497                 :            :         // when the user only wanted one of them. Specifically, there could
    2498                 :            :         // be a 1-block reorg away from the chain where transactions A and C
    2499                 :            :         // were accepted to another chain where B, B', and C were all
    2500                 :            :         // accepted.
    2501 [ -  + ][ #  # ]:         15 :         if (nDepth == 0 && wtx.mapValue.count("replaces_txid")) {
         [ -  + ][ -  + ]
    2502                 :          0 :             safeTx = false;
    2503                 :            :         }
    2504                 :            : 
    2505                 :            :         // Similarly, we should not consider coins from transactions that
    2506                 :            :         // have been replaced. In the example above, we would want to prevent
    2507                 :            :         // creation of a transaction A' spending an output of A, because if
    2508                 :            :         // transaction B were initially confirmed, conflicting with A and
    2509                 :            :         // A', we wouldn't want to the user to create a transaction D
    2510                 :            :         // intending to replace A', but potentially resulting in a scenario
    2511                 :            :         // where A, A', and D could all be accepted (instead of just B and
    2512                 :            :         // D, or just A and A' like the user would want).
    2513 [ -  + ][ -  + ]:         15 :         if (nDepth == 0 && wtx.mapValue.count("replaced_by_txid")) {
         [ #  # ][ -  + ]
    2514                 :          0 :             safeTx = false;
    2515                 :            :         }
    2516                 :            : 
    2517         [ +  - ]:         15 :         if (fOnlySafe && !safeTx) {
    2518                 :            :             continue;
    2519                 :            :         }
    2520                 :            : 
    2521         [ +  - ]:         15 :         if (nDepth < min_depth || nDepth > max_depth) {
    2522                 :            :             continue;
    2523                 :            :         }
    2524                 :            : 
    2525 [ +  + ][ +  + ]:         75 :         for (unsigned int i = 0; i < wtx.tx->vout.size(); i++) {
                 [ +  + ]
    2526 [ +  + ][ +  + ]:         90 :             if (wtx.tx->vout[i].nValue < nMinimumAmount || wtx.tx->vout[i].nValue > nMaximumAmount)
         [ +  + ][ +  - ]
                 [ +  - ]
    2527                 :            :                 continue;
    2528                 :            : 
    2529 [ +  + ][ -  + ]:         19 :             if (coinControl && coinControl->HasSelected() && !coinControl->fAllowOtherInputs && !coinControl->IsSelected(COutPoint(entry.first, i)))
         [ -  + ][ #  # ]
    2530                 :            :                 continue;
    2531                 :            : 
    2532         [ +  + ]:         19 :             if (IsLockedCoin(entry.first, i))
    2533                 :            :                 continue;
    2534                 :            : 
    2535         [ +  + ]:         15 :             if (IsSpent(locked_chain, wtxid, i))
    2536                 :            :                 continue;
    2537                 :            : 
    2538                 :         33 :             isminetype mine = IsMine(wtx.tx->vout[i]);
    2539                 :            : 
    2540         [ +  + ]:         11 :             if (mine == ISMINE_NO) {
    2541                 :            :                 continue;
    2542                 :            :             }
    2543                 :            : 
    2544 [ -  + ][ #  # ]:          7 :             if (!allow_used_addresses && IsUsedDestination(wtxid, i)) {
    2545                 :            :                 continue;
    2546                 :            :             }
    2547                 :            : 
    2548                 :         21 :             bool solvable = IsSolvable(*this, wtx.tx->vout[i].scriptPubKey);

         [ #  # ][ #  # ]
                 [ -  + ]
    2550                 :            : 
    2551 [ +  + ][ +  - ]:         14 :             vCoins.push_back(COutput(&wtx, i, nDepth, spendable, solvable, safeTx, (coinControl && coinControl->fAllowWatchOnly)));
    2552                 :            : 
    2553                 :            :             // Checks the sum amount of all UTXO's.
    2554         [ -  + ]:          7 :             if (nMinimumSumAmount != MAX_MONEY) {
    2555 [ #  # ][ #  # ]:          0 :                 nTotal += wtx.tx->vout[i].nValue;
    2556                 :            : 
    2557         [ #  # ]:          0 :                 if (nTotal >= nMinimumSumAmount) {
    2558                 :            :                     return;
    2559                 :            :                 }
    2560                 :            :             }

    2566                 :            :         }
    2567                 :            :     }

    2765                 :          0 : bool CWallet::SignTransaction(CMutableTransaction& tx)
    2766                 :            : {
    2767                 :          0 :     AssertLockHeld(cs_wallet);
    2768                 :            : 
    2769                 :            :     // sign the new tx
    2770                 :          0 :     int nIn = 0;
    2771 [ #  # ][ #  # ]:          0 :     for (auto& input : tx.vin) {
    2772         [ #  # ]:          0 :         std::map<uint256, CWalletTx>::const_iterator mi = mapWallet.find(input.prevout.hash);
    2773 [ #  # ][ #  # ]:          0 :         if(mi == mapWallet.end() || input.prevout.n >= mi->second.tx->vout.size()) {

    2775                 :            :         }
    2776                 :          0 :         const CScript& scriptPubKey = mi->second.tx->vout[input.prevout.n].scriptPubKey;
    2777                 :          0 :         const CAmount& amount = mi->second.tx->vout[input.prevout.n].nValue;
    2778                 :          0 :         SignatureData sigdata;

    2838                 :            : 
    2839                 :          1 : static bool IsCurrentForAntiFeeSniping(interfaces::Chain& chain, interfaces::Chain::Lock& locked_chain)
    2840                 :            : {
    2841         [ +  - ]:          1 :     if (chain.isInitialBlockDownload()) {
    2842                 :            :         return false;
    2843                 :            :     }
    2844                 :          1 :     constexpr int64_t MAX_ANTI_FEE_SNIPING_TIP_AGE = 8 * 60 * 60; // in seconds
    2845 [ -  + ][ -  + ]:          1 :     if (locked_chain.getBlockTime(*locked_chain.getHeight()) < (GetTime() - MAX_ANTI_FEE_SNIPING_TIP_AGE)) {
    2846                 :          0 :         return false;
    2847                 :            :     }
    2848                 :            :     return true;
    2849                 :            : }
    2850                 :            : 
    2851                 :            : /**
    2852                 :            :  * Return a height-based locktime for new transactions (uses the height of the
    2853                 :            :  * current chain tip unless we are not synced with the current chain
    2854                 :            :  */
    2855                 :          1 : static uint32_t GetLocktimeForNewTransaction(interfaces::Chain& chain, interfaces::Chain::Lock& locked_chain)
    2856                 :            : {
    2857         [ +  - ]:          1 :     uint32_t const height = locked_chain.getHeight().get_value_or(-1);
    2858                 :          1 :     uint32_t locktime;
    2859                 :            :     // Discourage fee sniping.
    2860                 :            :     //
    2861                 :            :     // For a large miner the value of the transactions in the best block and
    2862                 :            :     // the mempool can exceed the cost of deliberately attempting to mine two
    2863                 :            :     // blocks to orphan the current best block. By setting nLockTime such that
    2864                 :            :     // only the next block can include the transaction, we discourage this
    2865                 :            :     // practice as the height restricted and limited blocksize gives miners
    2866                 :            :     // considering fee sniping fewer options for pulling off this attack.
    2867                 :            :     //
    2868                 :            :     // A simple way to think about this is from the wallet's point of view we
    2869                 :            :     // always want the blockchain to move forward. By setting nLockTime this
    2870                 :            :     // way we're basically making the statement that we only want this
    2871                 :            :     // transaction to appear in the next block; we don't want to potentially
    2872                 :            :     // encourage reorgs by allowing transactions to appear at lower heights
    2873                 :            :     // than the next block in forks of the best chain.
    2874                 :            :     //
    2875                 :            :     // Of course, the subsidy is high enough, and transaction volume low
    2876                 :            :     // enough, that fee sniping isn't a problem yet, but by implementing a fix
    2877                 :            :     // now we ensure code won't be written that makes assumptions about
    2878                 :            :     // nLockTime that preclude a fix later.
    2879         [ +  - ]:          1 :     if (IsCurrentForAntiFeeSniping(chain, locked_chain)) {
    2880                 :          1 :         locktime = height;
    2881                 :            : 
    2882                 :            :         // Secondly occasionally randomly pick a nLockTime even further back, so
    2883                 :            :         // that transactions that are delayed after signing for whatever reason,
    2884                 :            :         // e.g. high-latency mix networks and some CoinJoin implementations, have
    2885                 :            :         // better privacy.
    2886         [ +  - ]:          1 :         if (GetRandInt(10) == 0)
    2887         [ +  - ]:          2 :             locktime = std::max(0, (int)locktime - GetRandInt(100));
    2888                 :            :     } else {
    2889                 :            :         // If our chain is lagging behind, we can't discourage fee sniping nor help
    2890                 :            :         // the privacy of high-latency transactions. To avoid leaking a potentially
    2891                 :            :         // unique "nLockTime fingerprint", set nLockTime to a constant.
    2892                 :            :         locktime = 0;
    2893                 :            :     }
    2894         [ -  + ]:          1 :     assert(locktime <= height);
    2895         [ -  + ]:          1 :     assert(locktime < LOCKTIME_THRESHOLD);
    2896                 :          1 :     return locktime;
    2897                 :            : }
    2898                 :            :

    2902         [ +  - ]:          1 :     if (change_type != OutputType::CHANGE_AUTO) {

    2919         [ #  # ]:          0 :             return OutputType::BECH32;

    2922                 :            :

    3142         [ #  # ]:          0 :                     strFailReason = _("Fee estimation failed. Fallbackfee is disabled. Wait a few blocks or enable -fallbackfee.").translated;
    3143                 :          0 :                     return false;
    3144                 :            :                 }
    3145                 :            : 
    3146         [ -  + ]:          1 :                 if (nFeeRet >= nFeeNeeded) {
    3147                 :            :                     // Reduce fee to only the needed amount if possible. This
    3148                 :            :                     // prevents potential overpayment in fees if the coins
    3149                 :            :                     // selected to meet nFeeNeeded result in a transaction that
    3150                 :            :                     // requires less fee than the prior iteration.
    3151                 :            : 
    3152                 :            :                     // If we have no change and a big enough excess fee, then
    3153                 :            :                     // try to construct transaction again only without picking
    3154                 :            :                     // new inputs. We now know we only need the smaller fee
    3155                 :            :                     // (because of reduced tx size) and so we should add a
    3156                 :            :                     // change output. Only try this once.
    3157 [ #  # ][ #  # ]:          0 :                     if (nChangePosInOut == -1 && nSubtractFeeFromAmount == 0 && pick_new_inputs) {
    3158                 :          0 :                         unsigned int tx_size_with_change = nBytes + coin_selection_params.change_output_size + 2; // Add 2 as a buffer in case increasing # of outputs changes compact size
    3159         [ #  # ]:          0 :                         CAmount fee_needed_with_change = GetMinimumFee(*this, tx_size_with_change, coin_control, nullptr);
    3160         [ #  # ]:          0 :                         CAmount minimum_value_for_change = GetDustThreshold(change_prototype_txout, discard_rate);
    3161         [ #  # ]:          0 :                         if (nFeeRet >= fee_needed_with_change + minimum_value_for_change) {
    3162                 :          0 :                             pick_new_inputs = false;
    3163                 :          0 :                             nFeeRet = fee_needed_with_change;
    3164                 :          0 :                             continue;
    3165                 :            :                         }
    3166                 :            :                     }
    3167                 :            : 
    3168                 :            :                     // If we have change output already, just increase it
    3169 [ #  # ][ #  # ]:          0 :                     if (nFeeRet > nFeeNeeded && nChangePosInOut != -1 && nSubtractFeeFromAmount == 0) {
                 [ #  # ]
    3170                 :          0 :                         CAmount extraFeePaid = nFeeRet - nFeeNeeded;
    3171                 :          0 :                         std::vector<CTxOut>::iterator change_position = txNew.vout.begin()+nChangePosInOut;
    3172                 :          0 :                         change_position->nValue += extraFeePaid;
    3173                 :          0 :                         nFeeRet -= extraFeePaid;
    3174                 :            :                     }
    3175                 :            :                     break; // Done, enough fee included.
    3176                 :            :                 }
    3177         [ -  + ]:          1 :                 else if (!pick_new_inputs) {
    3178                 :            :                     // This shouldn't happen, we should have had enough excess
    3179                 :            :                     // fee to pay for the new output and still meet nFeeNeeded
    3180                 :            :                     // Or we should have just subtracted fee from recipients and
    3181                 :            :                     // nFeeNeeded should not have changed
    3182         [ #  # ]:          0 :                     strFailReason = _("Transaction fee and change calculation failed").translated;
    3183                 :          0 :                     return false;
    3184                 :            :                 }
    3185                 :            : 
    3186                 :            :                 // Try to reduce change to include necessary fee
    3187 [ +  - ][ +  - ]:          1 :                 if (nChangePosInOut != -1 && nSubtractFeeFromAmount == 0) {
    3188                 :          1 :                     CAmount additionalFeeNeeded = nFeeNeeded - nFeeRet;
    3189 [ +  - ][ +  - ]:          2 :                     std::vector<CTxOut>::iterator change_position = txNew.vout.begin()+nChangePosInOut;
    3190                 :            :                     // Only reduce change if remaining amount is still a large enough output.
    3191         [ +  - ]:          1 :                     if (change_position->nValue >= MIN_FINAL_CHANGE + additionalFeeNeeded) {
    3192                 :          1 :                         change_position->nValue -= additionalFeeNeeded;
    3193                 :          1 :                         nFeeRet += additionalFeeNeeded;
    3194                 :          1 :                         break; // Done, able to increase fee from change
    3195                 :            :                     }
    3196                 :            :                 }
    3197                 :            : 
    3198                 :            :                 // If subtracting fee from recipients, we now know what fee we
    3199                 :            :                 // need to subtract, we have no reason to reselect inputs

    3201                 :          0 :                     pick_new_inputs = false;
    3202                 :            :                 }
    3203                 :            : 
    3204                 :            :                 // Include more fee and try again.
    3205                 :          0 :                 nFeeRet = nFeeNeeded;
    3206                 :          0 :                 coin_selection_params.use_bnb = false;
    3207                 :          0 :                 continue;

    3220                 :            :         // we use the highest possible value in that range (maxint-2)

    4064                 :            : }
    4065                 :            : 
    4066                 :            : /**
    4067                 :            :  * Compute smart timestamp for a transaction being added to the wallet.
    4068                 :            :  *
    4069                 :            :  * Logic:
    4070                 :            :  * - If sending a transaction, assign its timestamp to the current time.
    4071                 :            :  * - If receiving a transaction outside a block, assign its timestamp to the
    4072                 :            :  *   current time.
    4073                 :            :  * - If receiving a block with a future timestamp, assign all its (not already
    4074                 :            :  *   known) transactions' timestamps to the current time.
    4075                 :            :  * - If receiving a block with a past timestamp, before the most recent known
    4076                 :            :  *   transaction (that we care about), assign all its (not already known)
    4077                 :            :  *   transactions' timestamps to the same timestamp as that most-recent-known
    4078                 :            :  *   transaction.
    4079                 :            :  * - If receiving a block with a past timestamp, but after the most recent known
    4080                 :            :  *   transaction, assign all its (not already known) transactions' timestamps to
    4081                 :            :  *   the block time.
    4082                 :            :  *
    4083                 :            :  * For more information see CWalletTx::nTimeSmart,
    4084                 :            :  * https://bitcointalk.org/?topic=54527, or
    4085                 :            :  * https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/pull/1393.
    4086                 :            :  */
    4087                 :     110104 : unsigned int CWallet::ComputeTimeSmart(const CWalletTx& wtx) const
    4088                 :            : {
    4089                 :     110104 :     unsigned int nTimeSmart = wtx.nTimeReceived;
    4090         [ +  + ]:     110104 :     if (!wtx.hashUnset()) {
    4091                 :        112 :         int64_t blocktime;
    4092 [ -  + ][ +  - ]:        112 :         if (chain().findBlock(wtx.hashBlock, nullptr /* block */, &blocktime)) {
    4093                 :        112 :             int64_t latestNow = wtx.nTimeReceived;
    4094                 :        112 :             int64_t latestEntry = 0;
    4095                 :            : 
    4096                 :            :             // Tolerate times up to the last timestamp in the wallet not more than 5 minutes into the future
    4097                 :        112 :             int64_t latestTolerated = latestNow + 300;
    4098                 :        112 :             const TxItems& txOrdered = wtxOrdered;
    4099 [ +  + ][ +  + ]:        226 :             for (auto it = txOrdered.rbegin(); it != txOrdered.rend(); ++it) {
                 [ +  + ]
    4100         [ +  + ]:        220 :                 CWalletTx* const pwtx = it->second;
    4101         [ +  + ]:        220 :                 if (pwtx == &wtx) {
    4102                 :            :                     continue;
    4103                 :            :                 }
    4104                 :        108 :                 int64_t nSmartTime;
    4105                 :        108 :                 nSmartTime = pwtx->nTimeSmart;
    4106         [ -  + ]:        108 :                 if (!nSmartTime) {
    4107                 :          0 :                     nSmartTime = pwtx->nTimeReceived;
    4108                 :            :                 }
    4109         [ +  + ]:        108 :                 if (nSmartTime <= latestTolerated) {
    4110                 :        106 :                     latestEntry = nSmartTime;
    4111         [ +  + ]:        106 :                     if (nSmartTime > latestNow) {
    4112                 :          1 :                         latestNow = nSmartTime;
    4113                 :            :                     }
    4114                 :            :                     break;
    4115                 :            :                 }
    4116                 :            :             }
    4117                 :            : 
    4118 [ +  + ][ +  + ]:        226 :             nTimeSmart = std::max(latestEntry, std::min(blocktime, latestNow));
    4119                 :            :         } else {
    4120   [ #  #  #  # ]:          0 :             WalletLogPrintf("%s: found %s in block %s not in index\n", __func__, wtx.GetHash().ToString(), wtx.hashBlock.ToString());
         [ #  # ][ #  # ]
         [ #  # ][ #  # ]
         [ #  # ][ #  # ]
         [ #  # ][ #  # ]
         [ #  # ][ #  # ]
                 [ #  # ]
    4121                 :            :         }
    4122                 :            :     }
    4123                 :     110104 :     return nTimeSmart;
    4124                 :            : }

    4194                 :          0 : bool CWallet::Verify(interfaces::Chain& chain, const WalletLocation& location, bool salvage_wallet, std::string& error_string, std::string& warning_string)
    4195                 :            : {
    4196                 :            :     // Do some checking on wallet path. It should be either a:
    4197                 :            :     //
    4198                 :            :     // 1. Path where a directory can be created.
    4199                 :            :     // 2. Path to an existing directory.
    4200                 :            :     // 3. Path to a symlink to a directory.
    4201                 :            :     // 4. For backwards compatibility, the name of a data file in -walletdir.
